It was determined that the facility was in compliance with the requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 PA Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998. Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of an unannounced offsite revisit survey initiated on January 16, 2024, and completed on January 18, 2024, following an unannounced complaint investigation (CHL23C555V) initiated offsite on August 16, 2023, and completed offsite on September 14, 2023, at Good Shepherd Specialty Hospital. Initial comments:This report is the result of a full on-site Medicare recertification survey initiated on December 12, 2023, to December 14, 2023, at Good Shepherd Specialty Hospital.  It was determined that the facility was not in compliance with the requirements of 42 CFR, Title 42, Part 482 - Conditions of Participation for Hospitals. Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of a full on-site Medicare recertification survey initiated on December 12, 2023, to December 14, 2023, at Good Shepherd Specialty Hospital.  It was determined that the facility was not in compliance with the requirements of 42 CFR, Title 42, Part 482 - Conditions of Participation for Hospitals. Plan of Correction: 482.21 CONDITION QAPI:The hospital must develop, implement and maintain an effective, ongoing, hospital-wide, data-driven quality assessment and performance improvement program.The hospital's governing body must ensure that the program reflects the complexity of the hospital's organization and services; involves all hospital departments and services (including those services furnished under contract or arrangement); and focuses on indicators related to improved health outcomes and the prevention and reduction of medical errors.The hospital must maintain and demonstrate evidence of its QAPI program for review by CMS.Observations:Based on the systemic nature of the standard level deficiencies related to Quality Assessment and Performance Improvement, the facility failed to substantially comply with this condition.  Findings include:The following standards were cited and show a systemic nature of non-compliance with regards to Quality Assessment and Performance Improvement as follows:Standard: Program ScopeStandard: Performance Improvement Projects. Plan of Correction - To be completed: 02/23/2024An organized, structured and cohesive committeededicated to QAPI will meet monthly starting inJanuary, 2024. The committee will consist ofmulti-disciplinary members including, but not limited tonursing, rehabilitation therapy, respiratory therapy,case management, and leadership.   The purpose of thismeeting is to report on status of current PI projectstoward expected goals, receive feedback from thecommittee on next steps, and propose any new areasfor improvement.The framework for Good Shepherd Specialty's QAPIplan will be the PDCA model. The projects will bedeveloped from our Strategic Operations Plan, includingbut not limited to, ventilator weaning, ventilator patientmobility, returns to acute, hospital acquired pressureinjuries.The ongoing results of the PI projects will be reportedto medical executive committee on a monthly basis, Good ShepherdSpecialty Board of Directors on a quarterly basis and shared with front linestaff at a minimum of monthly. This plan will be monitored for assurance of compliance by the Good Shepherd Specialty Hospital Administrator who also will ensure sustainability by incorporating elements into the hospital strategic operations plan. 482.21 CONDITION QAPI: The hospital must develop, implement and maintain an effective, ongoing, hospital-wide, data-driven quality assessment and performance improvement program.The hospital's governing body must ensure that the program reflects the complexity of the hospital's organization and services; involves all hospital departments and services (including those services furnished under contract or arrangement); and focuses on indicators related to improved health outcomes and the prevention and reduction of medical errors.The hospital must maintain and demonstrate evidence of its QAPI program for review by CMS. (2) The hospital must measure, analyze, and track quality indicators ... and other aspects of performance that assess processes of care, hospital service and operations.(b)Program Data(1) The program must incorporate quality indicator data including patient care data, and other relevant data such as data submitted to or received from Medicare quality reporting and quality performance programs, including but not limited to data related to hospital readmissions and hospital-acquired conditions.(2) The hospital must use the data collected to--     (i)  Monitor the effectiveness and safety of services and quality of care; and .... (3) The frequency and detail of data collection must be specified by the hospital's governing body.Observations:Based on review of facility policies and procedures, facility documents, and interviews with staff (EMP), it was determined the facility failed to ensure the program measured, analyzed, and tracked quality indicators for contracted services.  Findings include: Review on December 13, 2023, of the facility's "Performance Improvement Plan Qaulity Assessment & Performance Improvement (QAPI) plan" dated 2023, revealed "... Design & Scope ... 2. Scope: QAPI activities will be integrated across all the care and service areas of our organization ... 3. Objectives: ... All departments and services will be involved in Performance Improvement activities ... 4. Quality Assurance: We will have a committee that will review data from areas of the organization on a monthly basis to assure systems are being monitored and maintained to achieve the highest level of quality for our organization ... Performance Improvement Projects (PIPs) 13. As part of our QAPI program, we will conduct Performance Improvement Projects ... We will document what projects are being conducted, the reason for conducting the projects and the measurable progress achieved on the projects ..."  A request was made to EMP1 on December 13, 2023, for the facility's contracted services quality indicators.  None was provided.  Interview with EMP1 on Decmeber 13, 2023, at 11:40 AM, confirmed there is no measuring, analyzing, and tracking of quality indicators for the following contracted service areas: laboratory, radiology, dietary services, pharmaceutical services, envionmental services and dialysis services.   Plan of Correction - To be completed: 02/23/2024Program data will be collected to monitor the effectiveness,safety of services, and quality of care on a monthly basis.Data collected will be used to identify opportunities ofcontinuous and ongoing improvement as well as mechanismsfor change to improve safety and quality for patients served.Data will be collected and reported on a balanced score cardon a monthly basis, starting in January 2024.  Measures will align with the initiatives from the strategic operational plan.
